    • Constructor Detail

      • Date

        public Date()
        Constructor: default; returns today's date

      • Date

        public Date(int m,
    int d,
    int y)
        Constructor: Does bounds-checking to ensure object represents a valid date
        Parameters:
        m - represents the month between 1 and 12
        d - represents the date between 1 and the corresponding number from array DAYS
        y - represents the year
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the date is invalid

      • Date

        public Date(java.lang.String sDate)
        Constructor: Does bounds-checking to ensure string represents a valid date
        Parameters:
        sDate - represents a date given in format mm-dd-yyyy as a string
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the date is invalid

        y - represents a date for a year supplied as an integer

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Date b)
        compares two Date objects
        Parameters:
        b - Date object
        Returns:
        0 if this Date is the same as Date b
        negative integer if this Date is earlier than Date b
        positive integer if this Date is after Date b

        advances the date by m months (fixed a bug on 2/22/2010)
        Parameters:
        m - represents the months to advance
        Returns:
        new Date object (as the originbal obj is immutable)
